snippet: Julius Malema, the polarizing leader of the party’s youth league, was fighting for his political life after accusing the South African president, Jacob Zuma, of becoming a dictator.
abstract: Julius Malema, the polarizing leader of the African National Congress Youth League, is abruptly suspended from the party, effectively silencing him within South Africa’s main political body as he fights for his political life; announcement comes after a speech in which Malema accused Pres Jacob Zuma of becoming a dictator.
lead_paragraph: Julius Malema, the polarizing leader of the party’s youth league, was fighting for his political life after accusing the South African president, Jacob Zuma, of becoming a dictator.

headline.seo: Julius Malema Suspended From African National Congress
headline.main: African National Congress Acts to Silence a Critic
headline.print_headline: South Africa’s Governing Party Acts to Silence a Critic of the President
